rice_data.name: Wild
rice_data.desc: If you're looking to cut calories and up your protein intake, wild rice is the better option. A serving of wild rice contains fewer calories and boasts double the protein content of brown rice.

rice_data.name: Jasmine
rice_data.desc: Jasmine rice is a long-grain rice. This means that it is longer and thinner than most other types of rice. It also tends to have a fluffy texture when cooked, rather than soft and clumpy.

rice_data.name: Short-grain
rice_data.desc: Very popular in Japan it is the preferred type of grain used for sushi, it should be cleaned whit water before being prepared.

rice_data.name: Bomba rice
rice_data.desc: Ideal for paella this rice is very popular in mediterranian countries, its main trait is that it absorbs lots of water so it requires lots of water to cook.

rice_data.name: Basmati Rice
rice_data.desc: Long grain, with a great aroma. Ideal for salads and cold dishes it can be combined with many dishes and is very popular in India

rice_data.name: Arborio Rice
rice_data.desc: Very popular in Italia, this rice is the preferred one for Risotto among Italians. It should be cooked al dente, while still slightly firm to the bite, and never washed or rinsed as it will lose the starchy coating that creates the creamy and slightly chewy texture once cooked.
